title: what's the best way to calculate md5 with very large file (~1GB)
body:
### What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
1.7

### What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
ubuntu14.04

### Question in detail
Current md5 calculation way is trying to load the content in memory then do the calculation finally.
But if the content is very large such a 1GB file, the memory consumption will be very high.

md5 itself is a 512 bits chunk based, so md5 in Golang is only loading a chunk then sum all ?
